meanings.def: the act of getting involved in and trying to influence a situation that should not really involve you, in a way that annoys other people
examples: interference (in something) They resent foreign interference in the internal affairs of their country.
interference with something interference with proper medical procedures
I will not tolerate such gross interference.
My boss said she would brook no interference from other departments.
The law is designed to prevent interference by local police.
They deeply resent interference in their affairs.
We will not allow any interference with the normal democratic processes.

meanings.def: interruption of a radio signal by another signal on a similar wavelength, causing extra noise that is not wanted
to clear the way for the player with the ball by blocking players from the other team
to help somebody by dealing with problems for them so that they do not need to deal with them
examples: You have plenty of friends that can always run interference for you.

idioms.def: to clear the way for the player with the ball by blocking players from the other team
examples: You have plenty of friends that can always run interference for you.
